title: [K-12] Designing Effective Science Teaching Methods in Pandemic Situations: Intentional Learning and Feedback Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary science curriculum knowledge, blended (online/offline) teaching experience, and comprehension of feedback methods
context.additional_context: Optimized face-to-face instruction in limited technological environments (smartphone-centric), emphasizing learner interaction and motivation strategies.

learning_goals: Learners can design lesson structures for cognitive activation (question prompting, inquiry activities) in pandemic scenarios
Learners can develop instructional materials integrating information presentation (visual aids, step-by-step explanations) and processing (summarization, concept linking) phases
Learners can measure learning effectiveness using smartphone-based feedback (quizzes, surveys) and parental collaboration strategies in limited-technology environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
